1.text: Slice the flesh from 6 or 7 large mangoes.

2.text: Put the mango pieces in a pot with sugar, lemon juice, and pectin.

3.text: Stir the mixture and cook it over low heat until the sugar dissolves.

4.text: Bring the jam to a boil over medium-high heat.

5.text: Cook the mango jam until it reaches 220 °F (104 °C).

6.text: Spoon the jam into sterilized jars.

7.text: Process the jars or store them in the refrigerator.

8.text: Swap half of the mango for peaches or nectarines.

9.text: Substitute honey or alternative sweetener for the granulated sugar.

10.text: Add 1 teaspoon (2 g) of your favorite ground spice for a unique flavor.

11.text: Leave out the sugar and pectin to make a loose mango spread.
